entry.content:
📸 How to Send Your Photos to Me

Step-by-Step Instructions (Simple, Free, and Works on Any Device)

Creating your slideshow project is easy.
Follow these steps to send me a large number of photos electronically, securely, and for free.  

______________________________________________________________________

🗂️ Step 1: Gather Your Files

  • Choose the photos you’d like me to use.
  • Put them in a single folder on your computer or phone.
  • If you want them in a specific order, rename the files (for example: 01, 02, 03…)
  • That’s it — now you’re ready to upload.

______________________________________________________________________

☁️ Step 2: Choose a Cloud Service

Any of these free options will work perfectly.
All are compatible with Apple, Android, Mac, and PC.

Option A — Google Drive (Recommended for Most People)

On a Computer:

  1. Go to https://drive.google.com.
  2. Sign in with your Google account (create one free if needed).
  3. Click + New → Folder, and name it (for example: “Slideshow Photos”).
  4. Double-click the folder to open it.
  5. Click + New → File Upload (or Folder Upload).
  6. Select your photos. They’ll start uploading.
  7. When finished, right-click the folder → Share.
  8. In the share settings, make sure it says “Anyone with the link can view.”
  9. Click Copy Link.

On a Phone (Google Drive App):

  1. Download and open the Google Drive app.
  2. Tap the + button → Folder, and name it.
  3. Open the folder → tap + → Upload → Photos and Videos.
  4. Select your photos.
  5. When done, tap the three dots ⋮ next to your folder → Share.
  6. Under “General Access,” change to Anyone with the link can view.
  7. Tap Copy Link.

Option B — Dropbox

On a Computer:

  1. Go to https://www.dropbox.com and log in (or sign up free).
  2. Click Upload → Folder (or Files).
  3. Select your photos to upload.
  4. When done, hover over the folder → click Share.
  5. Choose Anyone with the link can view.
  6. Click Copy Link.

On a Phone (Dropbox App):

  1. Install and open the Dropbox app.
  2. Tap + → Create or Upload File/Folder → Upload Photos.
  3. Choose your photos/videos.
  4. Tap the 3 dots ⋮ next to your uploaded folder → Share.
  5. Tap Create Link or Copy Link (make sure it says view-only).

Option C — iCloud (for iPhone/iPad users)

On iPhone/iPad:

  1. Open the Photos app.
  2. Tap Select → choose all the photos you want.
  3. Tap the Share icon (square with arrow up).
  4. Tap Add to Shared Album.
  5. If you don’t have one, tap New Shared Album → give it a name.
  6. Add me as a contact OR tap Copy iCloud Link to generate a share link.
  7. Send that link to me.

On a Computer (Mac or PC):

  1. Visit https://www.icloud.com and sign in.
  2. Click Photos, create a new album, and upload your photos.
  3. When finished, click Share → Copy Link.

Option D — OneDrive (Microsoft users)

On a Computer:

  1. Go to https://onedrive.com and log in.
  2. Click Upload → Folder or Files.
  3. Select your photos.
  4. When uploaded, right-click the folder → Share.
  5. Make sure it says Anyone with the link can view.
  6. Click Copy Link.

On a Phone (OneDrive App):

  1. Open the OneDrive app and log in.
  2. Tap + → Upload → choose your photos.
  3. Once uploaded, tap the 3 dots ⋮ next to your folder → Share.
  4. Set to Anyone with the link can view.
  5. Tap Copy Link.

______________________________________________________________________

💬 Step 3: Send Me the Link

Now that you have your link:

  1. Paste it into an email or text message.
  2. Send it to PreserveMyPhotosIdaho@gmail.com.
  3. I’ll download everything directly in full quality.

✅ Quick Tips

  • Don’t text the actual photos — texting compresses them.
  • Sharing the folder link keeps the original quality.
  • You don’t need to pay for cloud storage unless your files are huge (most projects fit in free space).
  • If you get stuck, I can walk you through it over the phone or with screenshots.

✨ You’re Done!

Once I receive your link, I’ll download your photos and start your slideshow project.

📩 Email: PreserveMyPhotosIdaho@gmail.com
📞 Text: 208-250-1410

entry.title: My Story and Mission
entry.summary: Hello, and thank you for stopping by! My name is Stephanie Slawson, and preserving memories is truly the work of my heart. My journey into photo and home movie digitizing began with a very personal project. A few years ago, I decided to surprise my…
entry.content:
Hello, and thank you for stopping by! My name is Stephanie Slawson, and preserving memories is truly the work of my heart.

My journey into photo and home movie digitizing began with a very personal project. A few years ago, I decided to surprise my parents for Christmas by digitizing all of their more than 7,000 loose photos and dozens of home videos. It was a massive undertaking, but it turned out to be the most meaningful Christmas gift our family has ever shared.

I chose to learn how to do it myself because I couldn’t bring myself to trust those irreplaceable memories to the mail or a big-box store that ships everything to a central processing center. I wanted every single photo and tape handled with care — and now, I bring that same level of care to every client I serve.

Along the way, I discovered that this work is my passion and my purpose. I don’t just scan photos and slides; I restore their color, crop and adjust them for the best presentation, and make sure important details are preserved. If a photo has dates, names, or notes written on it, I include that information right in the file name so those memories stay connected to their stories. I also take the time to organize everything thoughtfully, so when you receive your digital files, they make sense and flow naturally — it's not just a random folder of images.

I can also digitize home movies from most types of old camcorder and video recorder tapes and VHS tapes, as well as film reels, so that those cherished memories can play again for you and your loved ones to relive together.

At the beginning of 2025, I unexpectedly lost my dad. Having all of those photos and home movies easily accessible was an incredible comfort to our family. For his funeral, I created a tribute slideshow that captured his life and legacy — and through that experience, I realized how meaningful it is to help others do the same. Whether it’s for a wedding, graduation, memorial, or any special occasion, I would love to help you create a slideshow that honors your story and the people you love most.

This work truly brings joy to my heart. It’s more than a business to me — it’s my soul’s purpose to help preserve and celebrate the moments that matter most. I would be honored to help you preserve your family's memories one photo, video, or slideshow at a time.
